definitions.definition: notice or perceive (something) and register it as being significant.
examples: young people observe that decisions are made by others
synonyms: behold "every time he looked at her now

definitions.definition: watch (someone or something) carefully and attentively.
examples: Rob stood in the hallway, where he could observe the happenings on the street
synonyms: spy on; informaleyeball "I may not even observe them unawares"

definitions.definition: take note of or detect (something) in the course of a scientific study.
examples: the behavior observed in groups of chimpanzees

synonyms: pronounce; formalopine "she'd observed that the Christmas tree looked underdecorated"

definitions.definition: fulfill or comply with (a social, legal, ethical, or religious obligation).
examples: a tribunal must observe the principles of natural justice
synonyms: fulfill "both countries agreed to observe the ceasefire"

definitions.definition: maintain (silence) in compliance with a rule or custom, or temporarily as a mark of respect.
examples: a minute's silence will be observed

definitions.definition: perform or take part in (a rite or ceremony).
examples: relations gather to observe the funeral rites
many observed the one-year anniversary of the flood
synonyms: celebrate "this year he observed the anniversary at a ceremony on the South Lawn"
